title: Albin 79
text:
The Albin 79 is a <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a> <a href="sailboat">sailboat</a> that was designed by Rolf Magnusson as an <a href="International%20Offshore%20Rule">International Offshore Rule</a> <a href="Quarter%20Ton%20class">Quarter Ton class</a> <a href="Cruising%20%28maritime%29">cruiser</a>-<a href="Sailing%20%28sport%29">racer</a> and first built in 1974.
The Albin 79 designation indicates its <a href="length%20overall">length overall</a> in <a href="decimetre">decimetre</a>s.
Production.
The design was built by <a href="Albin%20Marine">Albin Marine</a> in <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a> from 1974 to 1977, with about 250 boats completed, but it is now out of production.
Design.
The Albin 79 is a recreational <a href="keelboat">keelboat</a>, built predominantly of <a href="fibreglass">fibreglass</a>, with wood trim. It has a <a href="masthead%20sloop">masthead sloop</a> rig with <a href="aluminum">aluminum</a> spars, a deck-stepped mast, wire <a href="standing%20rigging">standing rigging</a> and a single set of unswept spreaders. The hull has a <a href="raked%20stem">raked stem</a>; a raised counter, <a href="reverse%20transom">reverse transom</a>; a <a href="skeg">skeg</a>-mounted <a href="rudder">rudder</a> controlled by a <a href="tiller">tiller</a> and a fixed fin <a href="keel">keel</a>. It displaces and carries of lead ballast.
The boat has a draft of with the standard keel.
The boat is fitted with a Swedish <a href="Volvo%20Penta">Volvo Penta</a> MD5 <a href="diesel%20engine">diesel engine</a> of for docking and manoeuvring.
The design has sleeping accommodation for four to six people, with one cabin and one <a href="Head%20%28watercraft%29">head</a>.
For sailing the design may be equipped with a symmetrical <a href="spinnaker">spinnaker</a> of . It has a <a href="hull%20speed">hull speed</a> of .
